    • Field Detail

      • COVER_MAX_WIDTH

        public static final int COVER_MAX_WIDTH
        The maximum width of covers retrieved from content sources. Cover images should be enforced to this limit after being downloaded.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

    • Method Detail

      • htmlListToStringArray

        public static java.lang.String[] htmlListToStringArray(org.jsoup.nodes.Element list,
                                                       java.lang.String... itemTag)
        Creates an array of strings using the sub-elements of the given element.
        Parameters:
        list - the container (parent) element, such as a ul
        itemTag - (optional) the tag of the child elements, such as li
        Returns:
        an array of the text properties of the matching elements

      • tdWithHeader

        public static org.jsoup.nodes.Element tdWithHeader(org.jsoup.nodes.Element parent,
                                                   java.lang.String header)
        Retrieves the td element corresponding to the th with the given header.
        Parameters:
        parent - the parent element, which is probably a tbody
        header - the header text used to find a matching th; the first header which contains this text will be used
        Returns:
        the td element corresponding to the th with the given header

      • firstWord

        public static java.lang.String firstWord(java.lang.String string)
        Isolates the first word in the given string.

        This function is built to handle two cases: the input string solely contains a single word, and the input string contains a sequence of words, separated by spaces.

        Parameters:
        string - the source string
        Returns:
        the first word in the given string

      • parseInt

        public static int parseInt(java.lang.String text)
        Safely parses an int from the given string.

        This method can parse integers from text which uses US-style formatting, particularly including comma separated digits.

        If the given text is blank, this method will return 0.

        Parameters:
        text - a string which can reasonably be represented as an integer
        Returns:
        the int which is represented by the given text

      • parseLong

        public static long parseLong(java.lang.String text)
        Safely parses a long from the given string.

        This method can parse longs from text which uses US-style formatting, particularly including comma separated digits.

        If the given text is blank, this method will return 0.

        Parameters:
        text - a string which can reasonably be represented as an integer
        Returns:
        the int which is represented by the given text

      • parseDouble

        public static double parseDouble(java.lang.String text)
        Safely parses a double from the given string.

        If the given text is blank, this method will return 0.

        Parameters:
        text - a string which can reasonably be represented as a double
        Returns:
        the double which is represented by the given text

      • potentiallyRelativeDate

        public static java.time.LocalDateTime potentiallyRelativeDate(java.lang.String dateString,
                                                              java.time.format.DateTimeFormatter dateTimeFormatter)
        Parses a dateString using the given dateTimeFormatter, but first checks whether the dateString is a relative date, and calculates the appropriate LocalDateTime for either case.
        Parameters:
        dateString - the source date text
        dateTimeFormatter - the DateTimeFormatter for processing the dateString
        Returns:
        a LocalDateTime corresponding to the given dateString
